Attribute.Name: host disease

Attribute.Name: isolation source

Attribute.ShortDescription: Age of host

Attribute.Name: host description
Attribute.ShortDescription: Additional information not included in other defined vocabulary fields

Attribute.Name: host disease outcome
Attribute.ShortDescription: Final outcome of disease, e.g., death, chronic disease, recovery

Attribute.Name: host disease stage
Attribute.ShortDescription: Stage of disease

Attribute.Name: host health state
Attribute.ShortDescription: Information regarding health state of the individual

Attribute.Name: host sex
Attribute.ShortDescription: Gender or physical sex of the host

Attribute.Name: host subject id
Attribute.ShortDescription: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

Attribute.Name: host tissue sampled
Attribute.ShortDescription: Type of tissue the initial sample was taken from

Attribute.Name: locus tag prefix
Attribute.ShortDescription: A locus tag prefix for an annotated genome

Attribute.Name: passage history
Attribute.ShortDescription: Number of passages and passage method

Attribute.Name: pathotype
Attribute.ShortDescription: Some bacterial specific pathotypes (example Eschericia coli - STEC, UPEC)

Attribute.Name: serotype
Attribute.ShortDescription: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its antigenic properties. Same as serovar and serogroup

Attribute.Name: serovar
Attribute.ShortDescription: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its antigenic properties. Same as serovar and serotype. Sometimes used as species identifier in bacteria with shaky taxonomy.

Attribute.Name: specimen voucher
Attribute.ShortDescription: Identifier for the physical specimen. Use format: "[<institution-code>:[<collection-code>:]]<specimen_id>", eg, "UAM:Mamm:52179". See http://www.insdc.org/controlled-vocabulary-specimenvoucher-qualifier

Attribute.Name: subgroup
Attribute.ShortDescription: Taxonomy below subspecies; sometimes used in viruses to denote subgroups taken from a single isolate.

Attribute.Name: subtype
Attribute.ShortDescription: Used as classifier in viruses (e.g. HIV type 1, Group M, Subtype A).

Package.Name: Human
Package.Description: WARNING: Only use for human samples or cell lines that have no privacy concerns. For all studies involving human subjects, it is the submitter's responsibility to ensure that the information supplied protects participant privacy in accordance with all applicable laws, regulations and institutional policies. Make sure to remove any direct personal identifiers from your submission. If there are patient privacy concerns regarding making data fully public, please submit samples and data to DDBJ's Japanese Genotype-phenotype Archive (JGA) database. JGA has controlled access mechanisms and is an appropriate resource for hosting sensitive patient data. For samples isolated from humans use the Pathogen, Microbe or appropriate MIxS package.

Attribute.Name: sample salinity
Attribute.ShortDescription: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.ShortDescription: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample storage duration
Attribute.ShortDescription: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: sample storage location
Attribute.ShortDescription: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: sample storage temperature
Attribute.ShortDescription: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.ShortDescription: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: solar irradiance
Attribute.ShortDescription: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.ShortDescription: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used

Attribute.ShortDescription: temperature of the sample

Attribute.Name: ventilation rate
Attribute.ShortDescription: ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises

Attribute.ShortDescription: ventilation system used in the sampled premises

Attribute.Name: volatile organic compounds
Attribute.ShortDescription: concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature

Attribute.Name: wind direction
Attribute.ShortDescription: wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates

Attribute.Name: wind speed
Attribute.ShortDescription: speed of wind measured at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.ShortDescription: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample

Attribute.Name: aluminium saturation
Attribute.ShortDescription: aluminum saturation

Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining Al saturation

Attribute.Name: altitude

Attribute.ShortDescription: mean annual and seasonal temperature (degree Celsius)

Attribute.Name: drainage classification
Attribute.ShortDescription: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

Attribute.Name: fire

Attribute.Name: flooding
Attribute.ShortDescription: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

Attribute.Name: heavy metals

Attribute.Name: heavy metals method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

Attribute.Name: horizon

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.ShortDescription: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample

Attribute.ShortDescription: link to climate resource

Attribute.Name: local classification
Attribute.ShortDescription: soil classification based on local soil classification system

Attribute.Name: local classification method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass
Attribute.ShortDescription: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometers. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

Attribute.ShortDescription: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: sieving
Attribute.ShortDescription: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

Attribute.Name: slope gradient
Attribute.ShortDescription: commonly called "slope". The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

Attribute.ShortDescription: soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.ShortDescription: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used

Attribute.Name: storage conditions
Attribute.ShortDescription: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

Attribute.ShortDescription: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

Attribute.Name: texture method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining soil texture

Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining total organic C

Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique name for each sample (used as an ID and cannot be changed)

Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique title for each sample

Attribute.ShortDescription: Brief description

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.ShortDescription: Organism name in the NCBI Taxonomy database

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.ShortDescription: NCBI Taxonomy identifier

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.ShortDescription: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: strain
Attribute.ShortDescription: microbial or eukaryotic strain name

Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the local environment.

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.ShortDescription: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event.

Attribute.ShortDescription: Geographical origin of the sample (eg, "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi")

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.ShortDescription: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.ShortDescription: The geographical coordinates of the location in decimal degrees latitude and longitude (eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W)

Attribute.Name: number of replicons
Attribute.ShortDescription: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote

Attribute.ShortDescription: Primary publication or genome report in the form of pubmed ID, DOI or URL

Attribute.Name: observed biotic relationship
Attribute.ShortDescription: Free-living or from host

Attribute.ShortDescription: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when

Attribute.ShortDescription: history of dermatology disorders

Attribute.ShortDescription: dominant hand of the subject

Attribute.ShortDescription: Traits like antibiotic resistance/xenobiotic degration phenotypes

Attribute.ShortDescription: ethnicity of the subject

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.ShortDescription: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.ShortDescription: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.ShortDescription: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: pathogenicity
Attribute.ShortDescription: To what is the entity pathogenic

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.ShortDescription: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred

Attribute.Name: reference for biomaterial
Attribute.ShortDescription: Primary publication or genome report in the form of pubmed ID, DOI or URL

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.ShortDescription: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.ShortDescription: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample salinity
Attribute.ShortDescription: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.ShortDescription: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample storage duration
Attribute.ShortDescription: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: sample storage location
Attribute.ShortDescription: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: sample storage temperature
Attribute.ShortDescription: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.ShortDescription: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.ShortDescription: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used

Attribute.Name: subspecific genetic lineage
Attribute.ShortDescription: Information about the genetic distinctness of the lineage (eg., biovar, serovar)

Attribute.Name: temperature
Attribute.ShortDescription: temperature of the sample

Attribute.Name: trophic level
Attribute.ShortDescription: Feeding position in food chain (eg., chemolithotroph)

Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique name for each sample (used as an ID and cannot be changed)

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique title for each sample

Attribute.ShortDescription: Brief description

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.ShortDescription: Organism name in the NCBI Taxonomy database

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.ShortDescription: NCBI Taxonomy identifier

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.ShortDescription: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: strain
Attribute.ShortDescription: microbial or eukaryotic strain name

Attribute.Name: isolate
Attribute.ShortDescription: Identification of the specific individual

Attribute.Name: cultivar
Attribute.ShortDescription: Cultivar name

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.ShortDescription: Time of sampling (eg, 2008-01-23, 2008-01)

Attribute.Name: environment biome
Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the local environment.

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.ShortDescription: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event.

Attribute.Name: estimated size
Attribute.ShortDescription: Estimated size of genome

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.ShortDescription: Geographical origin of the sample (eg, "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi")

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.ShortDescription: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained

Attribute.Name: isolation and growth condition
Attribute.ShortDescription: Pubmed ID, DOI or URL of publication for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.ShortDescription: The geographical coordinates of the location in decimal degrees latitude and longitude (eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W)

Attribute.Name: number of replicons
Attribute.ShortDescription: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote

Attribute.Name: ploidy
Attribute.ShortDescription: The ploidy level of the genome (eg, allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid).

Attribute.Name: propagation
Attribute.ShortDescription: phage: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic; plasmid: incompatibility group; eukaryote: asexual/sexual

Attribute.Name: amniotic fluid color
Attribute.ShortDescription: specification of the color of the amniotic fluid sample

Attribute.Name: observed biotic relationship
Attribute.ShortDescription: Free-living or from host

Attribute.Name: blood disorder
Attribute.ShortDescription: history of blood disorders

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.ShortDescription: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when

Attribute.Name: major diet change in last six months
Attribute.ShortDescription: specification of major diet changes in the last six months

Attribute.Name: drug usage
Attribute.ShortDescription: any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage

Attribute.Name: ethnicity
Attribute.ShortDescription: ethnicity of the subject

Attribute.Name: extrachromosomal elements
Attribute.ShortDescription: Plasmids that have significance phenotypic consequence

Attribute.Name: fetal health status
Attribute.ShortDescription: specification of foetal health status, should also include abortion

Attribute.Name: gestation state
Attribute.ShortDescription: specification of the gestation state

Attribute.Name: health state
Attribute.ShortDescription: Information regarding health state of the individual

Attribute.Name: host age
Attribute.ShortDescription: Age of host

Attribute.Name: host body temperature
Attribute.ShortDescription: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

Attribute.Name: host diet
Attribute.ShortDescription: type of diet depending on the sample for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.

Attribute.ShortDescription: Name of relevant disease

Attribute.ShortDescription: the height of subject

Attribute.ShortDescription: mean annual and seasonal temperature (degree Celsius)

Attribute.Name: observed biotic relationship
Attribute.ShortDescription: Free-living or from host

Attribute.Name: crop rotation
Attribute.ShortDescription: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

Attribute.Name: current land use
Attribute.ShortDescription: present state of sample site

Attribute.Name: current vegetation
Attribute.ShortDescription: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

Attribute.Name: current vegetation method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in vegetation classification

Attribute.Name: drainage classification
Attribute.ShortDescription: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

Attribute.Name: encoded traits
Attribute.ShortDescription: Traits like antibiotic resistance/xenobiotic degration phenotypes

Attribute.Name: estimated size
Attribute.ShortDescription: Estimated size of genome

Attribute.Name: extreme event
Attribute.ShortDescription: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

Attribute.Name: extreme salinity
Attribute.ShortDescription: measured salinity

Attribute.Name: FAO classification
Attribute.ShortDescription: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

Attribute.Name: fire
Attribute.ShortDescription: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

Attribute.Name: flooding
Attribute.ShortDescription: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

Attribute.Name: health state
Attribute.ShortDescription: Information regarding health state of the individual

Attribute.Name: heavy metals
Attribute.ShortDescription: heavy metals present and concentrations of any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage

Attribute.Name: heavy metals method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

Attribute.Name: horizon
Attribute.ShortDescription: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath

Attribute.Name: horizon method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining the horizon

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.ShortDescription: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained

Attribute.Name: host taxonomy ID
Attribute.ShortDescription: NCBI taxonomy ID of the host

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.ShortDescription: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample

Attribute.Name: link to classification information
Attribute.ShortDescription: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

Attribute.Name: link to climate information
Attribute.ShortDescription: link to climate resource

Attribute.Name: local classification
Attribute.ShortDescription: soil classification based on local soil classification system

Attribute.Name: local classification method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass
Attribute.ShortDescription: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometers. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.ShortDescription: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: number of replicons
Attribute.ShortDescription: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote

Attribute.Name: pathogenicity
Attribute.ShortDescription: To what is the entity pathogenic

Attribute.Name: pH
Attribute.ShortDescription: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: pH method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining pH

Attribute.Name: pooling of DNA extracts
Attribute.ShortDescription: were multiple DNA extractions mixed? how many?

Attribute.Name: previous land use
Attribute.ShortDescription: previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: previous land use method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: profile position
Attribute.ShortDescription: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected, sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

Attribute.Name: reference for biomaterial
Attribute.ShortDescription: Primary publication or genome report in the form of pubmed ID, DOI or URL

Attribute.Name: salinity method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining salinity

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.ShortDescription: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.ShortDescription: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.ShortDescription: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.ShortDescription: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: sieving
Attribute.ShortDescription: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

Attribute.Name: slope gradient
Attribute.ShortDescription: commonly called "slope". The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

Attribute.Name: soil type
Attribute.ShortDescription: soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: soil type method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.ShortDescription: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used

Attribute.Name: storage conditions
Attribute.ShortDescription: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

Attribute.Name: subspecific genetic lineage
Attribute.ShortDescription: Information about the genetic distinctness of the lineage (eg., biovar, serovar)

Attribute.Name: texture
Attribute.ShortDescription: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

Attribute.Name: texture method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining soil texture

Attribute.Name: tillage
Attribute.ShortDescription: note method(s) used for tilling

Attribute.Name: total N method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining the total N

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen
Attribute.ShortDescription: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining total organic C

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon
Attribute.ShortDescription: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Attribute.Name: water content of soil
Attribute.ShortDescription: water content (g/g or cm3/cm3)

Attribute.Name: water content of soil method
Attribute.ShortDescription: reference or method used in determining the water content of soil

Attribute.ShortDescription: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total particulate carbon
Attribute.ShortDescription: total particulate carbon content

Attribute.Name: total phosphorus
Attribute.ShortDescription: total phosphorus concentration, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as phosphorus

Attribute.Name: trophic level
Attribute.ShortDescription: Feeding position in food chain (eg., chemolithotroph)

Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique name for each sample (used as an ID and cannot be changed)

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique title for each sample

Attribute.ShortDescription: Organism name in the NCBI Taxonomy database

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.ShortDescription: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.ShortDescription: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the local environment.

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude

Attribute.Name: barometric pressure
Attribute.ShortDescription: force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface

Attribute.Name: carbon dioxide
Attribute.ShortDescription: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: carbon monoxide
Attribute.ShortDescription: carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.ShortDescription: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when

Attribute.ShortDescription: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

Attribute.Name: humidity
Attribute.ShortDescription: amount of water vapour in the air

Attribute.ShortDescription: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample

Attribute.Name: methane
Attribute.ShortDescription: methane (gas) amount or concentration

Attribute.Name: sample storage duration
Attribute.ShortDescription: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: sample storage location
Attribute.ShortDescription: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: sample storage temperature
Attribute.ShortDescription: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.ShortDescription: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.ShortDescription: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used

Attribute.Name: temperature
Attribute.ShortDescription: temperature of the sample

Attribute.Name: time since last wash
Attribute.ShortDescription: specification of the time since last wash

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique name for each sample (used as an ID and cannot be changed)

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.ShortDescription: Unique title for each sample

Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.ShortDescription: Brief description

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.ShortDescription: Organism name in the NCBI Taxonomy database

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.ShortDescription: NCBI Taxonomy identifier

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.ShortDescription: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.ShortDescription: Time of sampling (eg, 2008-01-23, 2008-01)

Attribute.Name: environment biome
Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.ShortDescription: Descriptor of the local environment.

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.ShortDescription: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event.

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.ShortDescription: Geographical origin of the sample (eg, "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi")

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.ShortDescription: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.ShortDescription: The geographical coordinates of the location in decimal degrees latitude and longitude (eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W)

Attribute.Name: birth control
Attribute.ShortDescription: specification of birth control medication used

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.ShortDescription: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when

Attribute.Name: douche
Attribute.ShortDescription: date of most recent douche

Attribute.Name: ethnicity
Attribute.ShortDescription: ethnicity of the subject

Attribute.Name: gynecological disorder
Attribute.ShortDescription: history of gynecological disorders

Attribute.Name: host age
Attribute.ShortDescription: Age of host

Attribute.Name: host body temperature
Attribute.ShortDescription: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

Attribute.Name: host diet
Attribute.ShortDescription: type of diet depending on the sample for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.

Attribute.Name: host disease
Attribute.ShortDescription: Name of relevant disease

Attribute.Name: host height
Attribute.ShortDescription: the height of subject

Attribute.Name: host sex
Attribute.ShortDescription: Gender or physical sex of the host

Attribute.Name: host subject id
Attribute.ShortDescription: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

Attribute.Name: host tissue sampled
Attribute.ShortDescription: Type of tissue the initial sample was taken from

Attribute.Name: hrt
Attribute.ShortDescription: whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

Attribute.Name: hysterectomy
Attribute.ShortDescription: specification of whether hysterectomy was performed

Attribute.Name: medication code
Attribute.ShortDescription: can include multiple medication codes

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.ShortDescription: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample

Attribute.Name: medical history performed
Attribute.ShortDescription: whether full medical history was collected

Attribute.Name: menarche
Attribute.ShortDescription: date of most recent menstruation

Attribute.Name: menopause
Attribute.ShortDescription: date of onset of menopause

Attribute.ShortDescription: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.ShortDescription: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count
